channel.title: Saturdayproject on Shenanigans! - a blog on programming, technology and science
channel.description: Recent content in Saturdayproject on Shenanigans! - a blog on programming, technology and science

item.title: Rails 5.1 API app, part 5: Deploying with confidence
item.description: In this final part of our Rails API app series we’ll talk about specs, code coverage, continuous integration and deployment - and how to be certain your application is working.

item.title: Rails 5.1 API app, part 4: Authentication and authorization
item.description: Time to deal with authenticating users in our bookstore application.

item.title: Rails 5.1 API app, part 3: API versioning
item.description: We have two more things to tackle before our Rails API app is an MVP: namespacing the controllers and creating an authentication mechanism. We’ll tackle namespacing the controllers in this article - it might seem wordy, but it’s for a good reason.

item.title: Rails 5.1 API app, part 2: Modeling reality
item.description:
Oh yeah. Now we’re going hardcore. Well, not really.

While Rails embraces a continuously changing data model, it’s always good to stop and think for a minute about the domain we’re trying to magically lockwithin an app. We’re building a bookstore. So what’s in one?

item.title: Rails 5.1 API app, part 1: Setting up a Rails API app
item.description: It’s time to continue with our foray into Rails API app with Vue.js frontend! In Part 0 we discussed what technology we’ll be using and why - I highly recommend you read through it if you haven’t already. Now it’s time to get our Rails on.

item.title: Rails 5.1 API with Vue.js frontend, part 0: stack choices
item.description: I’ve been rather busy lately, and my progress in learning Vue.js has slowed down. However, I think that I’m ready to dive into making something more resembling a real application than Monster Hunter and GalaxyQuest. I believe that you learn best when your objective is teaching it to somebody else. Therefore, over the next couple of weeks I’ll be making and refining a simple bookstore app1, using Rails 5.1 for the API backend, and vue.

item.title: Saturday Project: GalaxyQuest - fuzzily searching github stars
item.description:
Okay, Thursday project. It’s my day off this week, what can I do.

I’m still on this Vue.js kick, so while studying Components, I built myself a little app.

item.title: Saturday Project: Monster Hunting with Vue.js
item.description: I’m studying Vue.js right now - here’s a simple app that I made in the process.

item.title: Saturday Project: Alien Generator in JavaScript
item.description: I’ve been studying ES6 a lot lately. Here’s a fun little project that we can do with it over an hour or so on a Saturday: an alien generator!

item.title: Ultrasonic theremin
item.description: Iâ€™ve been wanting to construct an instrument in the spirit of a theremin for quite a while. Of course, I have neither the skills to construct a proper theremin, nor the time to master them. What I do have is an Arduino board, some sensors and a couple of spare parts.
